item.title: House vibration from bus traffic over road manhole, 25th October
item.description:
Some years ago, works were carried where the road manhole in the picture sits. Ever since, some vibrations were felt in our house (which is just tansversal to the manhole) when a bus or equivalent passed by (not always but often, depending on its speed). In fact, a couple or so years ago as the metal cover of the whole was faulty, it made a loud noise disturbing all neighbours (which Southwark council eventually fixed the cover). However, the vibrations not only continued, they have gradually increased (they can be felt especially in the 2nd floor & loft, on the opposite side of the house). My hypothesis is that the cavity underneath the manhole has a direction towards the house, when the bus drives beyond certain speed generates a wave that transmit through the ground to the house foundations, transmiting the energy up the walls and upward till the end of the house in the 2nd floor and loft levels, manifesting itself in a vibration. We are concerned that this repeating and increasing vibration might lead to subsidience to the house (or an accident), so require immediate investigation and solution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princes Riverside Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SORN vehicle on street, 25th October
item.description:
This VW van has been up on bricks on a public road outside 30 Maple Road for weeks in contravention of the Clean Neighborhoods and Environment Act 2005. A DVLA check shows it as SORN and untaxed. The motorhome immediately behind it appears to have a blue power cable running loose across the pavement to the adjacent property and seems occupied.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pave by and roadside outside malorees infant and junior school, 25th October
item.description:
Huge amount of leaves debris piling up making impossible to manoeuvre pram or wheelchair, very slippery underfoot - children falling - also blocking drains - 3weeks present getting continually worse

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeping Willow tree, 25th October
item.description:
Why have you cut down the beautiful weeping willow tree ? Why have you left the area devastated- not even clearing away the debris No new trees have been planted in the park for over three years yet you have felled many established trees. Hardly any stump grinding has been undertaken - just ugly stumps left everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
